summary: People who need long-term services to help with routine daily activities, such as bathing and eating, often prefer to remain in their homes and communities rather than receive care in nursing homes or other institutions. State Medicaid programs must cover nursing home care, but can choose to cover most home- and community-based care—and they’re increasingly opting to do so. title: Medicaid Home- and Community-Based Services: Selected States' Program Structures and Challenges Providing Services
